text: Paul and Timothy, servants of Christ Jesus, to all the saints in Christ Jesus that are at Philippi, with the bishops and deacons:
speaker: Narrator

text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: I thank my God upon all my remembrance of you,
speaker: Narrator

text: always in every supplication of mine on behalf of you all making my supplication with joy,
speaker: Narrator

text: for your fellowship in furtherance of the gospel from the first day until now;
speaker: Narrator

text: being confident of this very thing, that he who began a good work in you will perfect it until the day of Jesus Christ:
speaker: Narrator

text: even as it is right for me to be thus minded on behalf of you all, because I have you in my heart, inasmuch as, both in my bonds and in the defence and confirmation of the gospel, ye all are partakers with me of grace.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God is my witness, how I long after you all in the tender mercies of Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this I pray, that your love may abound yet more and more in knowledge and all discernment;
speaker: Narrator

text: so that ye may approve the things that are excellent; that ye may be sincere and void of offence unto the day of Christ;
speaker: Narrator

text: being filled with the fruits of righteousness, which are through Jesus Christ, unto the glory and praise of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I would have you know, brethren, that the things which happened unto me have fallen out rather unto the progress of the gospel;
speaker: Narrator

text: so that my bonds became manifest in Christ throughout the whole praetorian guard, and to all the rest;
speaker: Narrator

text: and that most of the brethren in the Lord, being confident through my bonds, are more abundantly bold to speak the word of God without fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some indeed preach Christ even of envy and strife; and some also of good will:
speaker: Narrator

text: the one do it of love, knowing that I am set for the defence of the gospel;
speaker: Narrator

text: but the other proclaim Christ of faction, not sincerely, thinking to raise up affliction for me in my bonds.
speaker: Narrator

text: What then? only that in every way, whether in pretence or in truth, Christ is proclaimed; and therein I rejoice, yea, and will rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know that this shall turn out to my salvation, through your supplication and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: according to my earnest expectation and hope, that in nothing shall I be put to shame, but that with all boldness, as always, so now also Christ shall be magnified in my body, whether by life, or by death.
speaker: Narrator

text: For to me to live is Christ, and to die is gain.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if to live in the flesh,â€”if this shall bring fruit from my work, then what I shall choose I know not.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I am in a strait betwixt the two, having the desire to depart and be with Christ; for it is very far better:
speaker: Narrator

text: yet to abide in the flesh is more needful for your sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: And having this confidence, I know that I shall abide, yea, and abide with you all, for your progress and joy in the faith;
speaker: Narrator

text: that your glorying may abound in Christ Jesus in me through my presence with you again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only let your manner of life be worthy of the gospel of Christ: that, whether I come and see you or be absent, I may hear of your state, that ye stand fast in one spirit, with one soul striving for the faith of the gospel;
speaker: Narrator

text: and in nothing affrighted by the adversaries: which is for them an evident token of perdition, but of your salvation, and that from God;
speaker: Narrator

text: because to you it hath been granted in the behalf of Christ, not only to believe on him, but also to suffer in his behalf:
speaker: Narrator

text: having the same conflict which ye saw in me, and now hear to be in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If there is therefore any exhortation in Christ, if any consolation of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any tender mercies and compassions,
speaker: Narrator

text: make full my joy, that ye be of the same mind, having the same love, being of one accord, of one mind;
speaker: Narrator

text: doing nothing through faction or through vainglory, but in lowliness of mind each counting other better than himself;
speaker: Narrator

text: not looking each of you to his own things, but each of you also to the things of others.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have this mind in you, which was also in Christ Jesus:
speaker: Narrator

text: who, existing in the form of God, counted not the being on an equality with God a thing to be grasped,
speaker: Narrator

text: but emptied himself, taking the form of a servant, being made in the likeness of men;
speaker: Narrator

text: and being found in fashion as a man, he humbled himself, becoming obedient even unto death, yea, the death of the cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore also God highly exalted him, and gave unto him the name which is above every name;
speaker: Narrator

text: that in the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of things in heaven and things on earth and things under the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: and that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, my beloved, even as ye have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling;
speaker: Narrator

text: for it is God who worketh in you both to will and to work, for his good pleasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do all things without murmurings and questionings:
speaker: Narrator

text: that ye may become blameless and harmless, children of God without blemish in the midst of a crooked and perverse generation, among whom ye are seen as lights in the world,
speaker: Narrator

text: holding forth the word of life; that I may have whereof to glory in the day of Christ, that I did not run in vain neither labor in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, and if I am offered upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I joy, and rejoice with you all:
speaker: Narrator

text: and in the same manner do ye also joy, and rejoice with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I hope in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy shortly unto you, that I also may be of good comfort, when I know your state.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have no man likeminded, who will care truly for your state.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they all seek their own, not the things of Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye know the proof of him, that, as a child serveth a father, so he served with me in furtherance of the gospel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Him therefore I hope to send forthwith, so soon as I shall see how it will go with me:
speaker: Narrator

text: but I trust in the Lord that I myself also shall come shortly.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I counted it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother and fellow-worker and fellow-soldier, and your messenger and minister to my need;
speaker: Narrator

text: since he longed after you all, and was sore troubled, because ye had heard that he was sick:
speaker: Narrator

text: for indeed he was sick nigh unto death: but God had mercy on him; and not on him only, but on me also, that I might not have sorrow upon sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have sent him therefore the more diligently, that, when ye see him again, ye may rejoice, and that I may be the less sorrowful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Receive him therefore in the Lord with all joy; and hold such in honor:
speaker: Narrator

text: because for the work of Christ he came nigh unto death, hazarding his life to supply that which was lacking in your service toward me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally, my brethren, rejoice in the Lord. To write the same things to you, to me indeed is not irksome, but for you it is safe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beware of the dogs, beware of the evil workers, beware of the concision:
speaker: Narrator

text: for we are the circumcision, who worship by the Spirit of God, and glory in Christ Jesus, and have no confidence in the flesh:
speaker: Narrator

text: though I myself might have confidence even in the flesh: if any other man thinketh to have confidence in the flesh, I yet more:
speaker: Narrator

text: circumcised the eighth day, of the stock of Israel, of the tribe of Benjamin, a Hebrew of Hebrews; as touching the law, a Pharisee;
speaker: Narrator

text: as touching zeal, persecuting the church; as touching the righteousness which is in the law, found blameless.
speaker: Narrator

text: Howbeit what things were gain to me, these have I counted loss for Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea verily, and I count all things to be loss for the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord: for whom I suffered the loss of all things, and do count them but refuse, that I may gain Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: and be found in him, not having a righteousness of mine own, even that which is of the law, but that which is through faith in Christ, the righteousness which is from God by faith:
speaker: Narrator

text: that I may know him, and the power of his resurrection, and the fellowship of his sufferings, becoming conformed unto his death;
speaker: Narrator

text: if by any means I may attain unto the resurrection from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not that I have already obtained, or am already made perfect: but I press on, if so be that I may lay hold on that for which also I was laid hold on by Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brethren, I count not myself yet to have laid hold: but one thing I do, forgetting the things which are behind, and stretching forward to the things which are before,
speaker: Narrator

text: I press on toward the goal unto the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us therefore, as many as are perfect, be thus minded: and if in anything ye are otherwise minded, this also shall God reveal unto you:
speaker: Narrator

text: only, whereunto we have attained, by that same rule let us walk.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brethren, be ye imitators together of me, and mark them that so walk even as ye have us for an ensample.
speaker: Narrator

text: For many walk, of whom I told you often, and now tell you even weeping, that they are the enemies of the cross of Christ:
speaker: Narrator

text: whose end is perdition, whose god is the belly, and whose glory is in their shame, who mind earthly things.
speaker: Narrator

text: For our citizenship is in heaven; whence also we wait for a Saviour, the Lord Jesus Christ:
speaker: Narrator

text: who shall fashion anew the body of our humiliation, that it may be conformed to the body of his glory, according to the working whereby he is able even to subject all things unto himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore, my brethren beloved and longed for, my joy and crown, so stand fast in the Lord, my beloved.
speaker: Narrator

text: I exhort Euodia, and I exhort Syntyche, to be of the same mind in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, I beseech thee also, true yokefellow, help these women, for they labored with me in the gospel, with Clement also, and the rest of my fellow-workers, whose names are in the book of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice in the Lord always: again I will say, Rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let your forbearance be known unto all men. The Lord is at hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: In nothing be anxious; but in everything by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known unto God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the peace of God, which passeth all understanding, shall guard your hearts and your thoughts in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally, brethren, whatsoever things are true, whatsoever things are honorable, whatsoever things are just, whatsoever things are pure, whatsoever things are lovely, whatsoever things are of good report; if there be any virtue, and if there be any praise, think on these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: The things which ye both learned and received and heard and saw in me, these things do: and the God of peace shall be with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I rejoice in the Lord greatly, that now at length ye have revived your thought for me; wherein ye did indeed take thought, but ye lacked opportunity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not that I speak in respect of want: for I have learned, in whatsoever state I am, therein to be content.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know how to be abased, and I know also how to abound: in everything and in all things have I learned the secret both to be filled and to be hungry, both to abound and to be in want.
speaker: Narrator

text: I can do all things in him that strengtheneth me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Howbeit ye did well that ye had fellowship with my affliction.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye yourselves also know, ye Philippians, that in the beginning of the gospel, when I departed from Macedonia, no church had fellowship with me in the matter of giving and receiving but ye only;
speaker: Narrator

text: for even in Thessalonica ye sent once and again unto my need.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not that I seek for the gift; but I seek for the fruit that increaseth to your account.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have all things, and abound: I am filled, having received from Epaphroditus the things that came from you, an odor of a sweet smell, a sacrifice acceptable, well-pleasing to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And my God shall supply every need of yours according to his riches in glory in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now unto our God and Father be the glory for ever and ever. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salute every saint in Christ Jesus. The brethren that are with me salute you.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the saints salute you, especially they that are of Caesarâ€™s household.
speaker: Narrator

text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
speaker: Narrator
